DataElement.preferredName: PI-RADS Spectroscopy Citrate Peak And Choline Peak Assessed Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score to represent a structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS) using citrate peak and choline peak concentrations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PI-RADS Spectroscopy Citrate Peak And Choline Peak Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy._The technique of measuring the emission and absorption of different wavelengths (spectra) of visible and non-visible light. This can be done via a spectroscope, which consists of a slit, prism, collimator lens, object lens, and a grating._A salt or ester of citric acid._The most extreme possible amount or value; the highest point._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Water-soluble vitamin that is a precursor for acetylcholine, phospholipids, and the methyl donor betaine. (DRI)_The most extreme possible amount or value; the highest point._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A structured reporting scheme for multiparametric prostate cancer imaging and diagnosis. Prostate images are obtained using multiple MRI techniques including T2 weighted images, a dynamic contrast-enhanced study (DCE), diffusion weighted imaging (DWI), and possibly spectroscopy (MRS). Each lesion receives a score from 1 to 5 for each individual imaging parameter, as well as an overall 1-5 grading score reflecting the likelihood of clinically significant cancer, with 1 being most probably benign and 5 being highly suspicious of malignancy.

Concepts.definition: The technique of measuring the emission and absorption of different wavelengths (spectra) of visible and non-visible light. This can be done via a spectroscope, which consists of a slit, prism, collimator lens, object lens, and a grating.
A salt or ester of citric acid.
The most extreme possible amount or value; the highest point.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Water-soluble vitamin that is a precursor for acetylcholine, phospholipids, and the methyl donor betaine. (DRI)
